IRS990.MissionDesc: TO INSPIRE EACH CHILD'S UNIQUE POTENTIAL AND DESIRE FOR LIFE-LONG LEARNING THROUGH A STRONG ACADEMIC, SOCIAL AND ENVIRONMENTAL CURRICULUM.
IRS990.Desc: INSTRUCTION TO PUPILS THROUGH FACULTY AND CURRICULUM ON A CAMPUS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The School is exempt from income taxes under Section 501(c)(3) of the Internal Revenue Code and Section 23701(d) of the State Revenue and Taxation Code. The Financial Accounting Standards Board (FASB) issued Accounting Standards Codification No. 740-10, Accounting for Uncertainties in Income Tax, which sets a minimum threshold for financial statement recognition of the benefit of a tax position taken or expected to be taken in a tax return. The School has reviewed its positions for all open tax years and has determined that it has no uncertain tax positions requiring accrual or disclosure.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Part XI, Line 2d: Other revenue amounts included in F/S but not included on form 990
Part XI, Line 4b: Other revenue amounts included on 990 but not included in F/S
Part XII, Line 2d: Other expenses and losses per audited F/S
Part XII, Line 4b: Other revenue amounts included on 990 but not included in F/S
Schedule E, Line 3 - Racially Nondiscriminatory Policy Publicized
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: NOTICE OF NON-DISCRIMINATORY POLICY WAS ADVERTISED ON THE SCHOOL WEBSITE. POLICY WAS ALSO PUBLISHED IN THE SCHOOL'S FINANCIAL AID APPLICATION AND IN AN APPLICATION REQUIREMENTS CHECKLIST IN THE SCHOOL'S APPLICATION PACKAGE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Schedule E, Line 4 - Explanation of Records and Materials Not Maintained
Schedule E, Line 5 - Explanation of Organization Discrimination by Race
Grantmaker's Description of How Grants are Used
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE SCHOOL REQUIRES A FINANCIAL AID APPLICATION, FAMILY TAX RETURNS, AND THE FAMILY INCOME STATEMENT. THE HEAD OF SCHOOL AND BUSINESS MANAGER REVIEW THE FINANCIAL AID OFFERS AND ANY DISCOUNTS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 11b: Form 990 Review Process
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: A COPY OF THE 990 IS PROVIDED TO THE PRESIDENT, VICE PRESIDENT, TREASURER, AND HEAD OF SCHOOL FOR APPROVAL.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 12c: Explanation of Monitoring and Enforcement of Conflicts
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ALL BOARD MEMBERS SIGN A COMMITMENT TO SERVE, A CONFLICT OF INTEREST STATEMENT, AND A BOARD MEMBER CODE OF ETHICS. THE FORMS ARE UPDATED ANNUALLY. THE HEAD OF SCHOOL MONITORS ALL SCHOOL CONTRACTS AND AGREEMENTS FOR CONFLICT OF INTEREST.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 15a: Compensation Review & Approval Process - CEO, Top Management
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE HEAD OF SCHOOL'S SALARY IS CALCULATED TO THE CAIS MEDIANS, ONE YEAR TRAILING. THE PROPOSED SALARY IS REVIEWED AND APPROVED BY THE BOARD PRESIDENT AND TREASURER.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 15b: Compensation Review and Approval Process for Officers and Key Employees
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE TOP MANAGEMENT OFFICIALS' SALARIES ARE REVIEWED TO THE CAIS MEDIANS, ONE YEAR TRAILING. THE PROPOSED SALARY IS REVIEWED AND APPROVED BY THE HEAD OF SCHOOL.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 19: Other Organization Documents Publicly Available
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE AVAILABLE THROUGH THE HEAD OF SCHOOL AND/OR BUSINESS OFFICE.
